website_summaries.verdict: The Xbox 360 Wireless Gaming Receiver lets you use wireless Xbox 360 peripherals with your Windows PC, but it won't be a must-have PC gaming peripheral until more compatible games are available.
pros: guaranteed compatibility with most Games for Windows titles
cons: Early software drivers are a little rough around the edges
no software for mapping controls to games that lack gamepad support
may need to unplug nearby Xbox 360s to avoid conflicts

customer_reviews.title: Beware not new in box
customer_reviews.text: The item said New on description and box label but when I opened the box the item was clearly used with a big card saying refebished. Was in a plastic bag not sealed. It had directions that said it was to come with a wireless keyboard. The item worked but I'm Very disiponted! when you buy new it should be New.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Lane

customer_reviews.title: Another one bites the dust
customer_reviews.text: These just are not designed to last. This is the third wireless receiver I've gone through in the past 4 years. The first was a legit one from Microsoft, the other two the knockoffs available here on Amazon (the very item you're viewing now). They all worked fine for a while and then die for no apparent reason. It gets left plugged in and sits in the same place the whole time so it's not like there's any stress on it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: TRASH.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a mess. No, I didn’t get an offbrand reciever, it just doesn’t work. I tried installing and reinstalling the drivers, switching usb ports, checking device manager and deleting my usb hub programs, tried uninstalling the device and downloading online drivers, checking steam settings, using different controllers, and you guess what? F***ING. NOTHING. IT WILL KEEP TREATING THE CONTROLLER LIKE A KEYBOARD AND MOUSE! IT DOESN’T EVEN SHOW UP IN DEVICE MANAGER!! I. SPENT. FIVE. HOURS. TRYING TO MAKE IT WORK BUT NOTHINGGGGGG. I WOULD GIVE 0 STARS IF AMAZON LET ME. With a severe headache, Isaac Hipkiss.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Edward Hipkiss

customer_reviews.title: it installed pretty fast, and I was good to go
customer_reviews.text: It took seconds to download the software. I didn't have to go to some website or anything. Just put the disc in, it installed pretty fast, and I was good to go. I'm using windows 10. I had to unplug my xbox 360 at first so that the controllers wouldn't automatically connect to that instead., but both of my wireless controllers were able to hook up to the device, and worked perfectly when I tested them out in a game of dive kick
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basically plug and play for Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: With updated Windows 10, the drivers automagically load. Pairing with a controller was equally easy. Item as described, arrived on time. Would order again, if necessary. One thing to note, and it's something other reviewers have mentioned: the item is not shipped in 'official' packaging. May seem sketchy to receive the device, instructions and CD (inorite?) in a plain manilla shipping pouch, but it's okay. If what you need is a thingy to let your XBox 360 controller connect to your PC, this is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Carrier

customer_reviews.title: it worked like a dream
customer_reviews.text: For people that are interested in reviews of products several years after purchase please see my experience below: Previous years product was purchased: 8+ Years Shipping: As expected Amazon handling: As expected Review: I bought this Xbox wireless receiver to use my controller on my PC. it worked like a dream! No issues with Drivers or anything. I love the feel of the xbox controller and now to use it for games on the PC it's great. It's been over 8 years and I still use it occasionally. I did purchase two other ones one for a friend and the other for my wife. All in working order. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Gently used, just stopped working one day. Took it apart and didn't see any obvious burn marks/scorching on the circuit board. The cable tested fine, it's definitely something defective on the board itself. Don't waste your money on this, it won't last any longer than the cheap ones.
customer_reviews.author: W. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Not a new item!
customer_reviews.text: Beware that this item sold by MICROSOFT themselves is NOT new in box. It arrived bare wrapped in bubble wrap, no original packing materials in sight. Further inspection shows wear marks on both the dongle and the USB end of the device. This is highly disingenuous when the asking price is $49.99 and its sold by the original manufacturer with no indication on the product page that the item is either used or refurbished. While my item works, I have no way of knowing if it's been used once or for years meaning It is unlikely to last.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: just like using an Xbox 360
customer_reviews.text: Just plug and play on Windows 10 on a Surface Pro 4, no drivers installed. After pairing the controllers the first time they are recognized every time, just like using an Xbox 360. I occasionally have an issue where my Xbox One bluetooth controller seems to get inputs from one of the 360 controllers at the same time, but I don't know if that is an issue with this receiver or just Windows getting confused between the bluetooth and the receiver. Restarting the game seems to make it go away.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Great USB accessory for playing games on the computer
customer_reviews.text: This USB receiver is an awesome addition for any video game player. Within minutes of installing and plugging it in, I was able to link up several Xbox 360 controllers. I use these to play several N64 emulator games (Mario Kart, Goldeneye) and they work great. Every few uses, I occasionally have to reassign the buttons but that's not too big a deal. Pros: - Quick and easy set up - Small and compact device - No lag Cons - Occasionally have to reset the assigned buttons Overally, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Egleston

customer_reviews.title: Does what its suppose to how its suppose to, no muss no fuss.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people are complaining that its not the actual Microsoft version because of the Japanese writing. and the cut rate packaging. However, I compared to my friends that he got from BestBuy and and EVERYTHING MATCHES UP! this is not an imitation and if it is they should be sued for full on likeness rights. This thing is the real deal, connects my 360 controllers to BOTH my windows 10 desktop and windows 10 gaming laptop. Range is just as good as an actual XBOX 360(roughly 25-30 feet). I didn't even need to software because the second I plugged this in and connected my controllers to it, it automatically recognized the hardware as a Microsoft hardware peripheral.
customer_reviews.author: Avalir

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This receiver works perfectly! It came packed safely and everything. This product came with a disc for you to setup the software but I suppose that wasn't needed for by laptops without a disc drive. I literally just plugged it into my computer and I was ready to go. It works perfectly with Steam and recognizes your controller with no problems. Totally recommended- grab it while it's a good price!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Better to buy this official version, then to pay for the cheaper ones.
customer_reviews.text: I already made the mistake of buying one that was a cheap knockoff of this one. And I tell you from experience to stay away from the cheap one. There is a absolute reason as to why it's cheap, and why this one is more expensive. It's because this one actually works and the other one is just a waste of your time and your money, do yourself a favor and purchase this one instead because it actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Device That Works as It Should
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem. I owned Xbox 360 wireless controllers that would not work with my PC even when I attached them using USB. I had wanted to use my controllers for racing and flying games desperately and was told I should look into Xbox One wired controllers. Not wanting to spend the cost of those controllers, I came across theas another suggestion. After ordering and installing the device, I was very happy to see that my older Xbox 360 wireless controllers were now working as they should on my new PC. It was a simple fix and much cheaper than buying new controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Dean C. Neitman

customer_reviews.title: Probably not actually "new" but it does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected. Plugged it into my PC, Windows 10 OS automatically installed a driver and from there it was just a matter of syncing a controller. I don't believe it was actually new. It came in a plain brown envelope and is clean, but nothing about it looks factory new. I used to refurbish and sell video game accessories and in my opinion, the one I got is refurbished and is being sold as new. That's the only reason I deducted a star.
customer_reviews.author: R.A.M.Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Working so far as expected
customer_reviews.text: Someone did mention that there is not a Microsoft holographic seal on this device. I didn't see one either, so not sure if it's actually a genuine Microsoft product, but it does work as expected when playing games on the Raspberry Pi 3. What I thought was quirky was that I expected the Xbox controller to show just the "1" light to show it was player 1, but when connected to this it blinks all 4 "player" lights constantly. That might be annoying if you stare at the controller for a bit. Otherwise, connects fast and works perfectly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Justaguy

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product!!! I love being able to use my pink Xbox 360 controller with my computer for gaming!! I was not huge on playing most games on the PC prior to this. I mainly like to play shooter ish games like Halo and such.. I did love the Assassin's Creed games as well. It functions well with no issues for many hours of gaming. I would definitely recommend this to anyone that likes their Xbox controller but wants to play on PC!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use & Affordable...
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these -- one for myself and one for my husband. Initially, after switching from console gaming to PC gaming I tried to get the hang of using a keyboard rather than a controller. It worked well for some games, but for a select few I still really wanted to use controllers. This has allowed me to have that without having to use additional programs and at a relatively affordable cost. I really like these receivers and would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGeekyGirlTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: This was my fourth MS-branded wireless receiver to die since 2008. Just one day it will stop working with no warning. At least this one lasted for about 4 years. I could have purchased a wired controller for what i have paid for the PC receivers.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: i think i just wasnt doing it right
customer_reviews.text: could never get it to work properly but I think that is my fault so I'm not rating it low, I'm not real sure about windows 10 compatibility, I can say it was well built and had I tried harder it would have probably worked fine, I just wound up using a cable to connect an xbox one controller to the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Clone Hero
customer_reviews.text: It took about a week to show up but when I got it, Literally no issues. I plugged it in and it detected right away. Opened up Clone Hero and connected my Guitar controller, Once again, no issues. And it was detected right away and started playing. No lag or anything. Works PERFECTLY. Just make sure you are using a wireless Xbox 360 Guitar Hero controller if you are using this for Clone Hero. Has worked perfectly the past 3 days of non stop use.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana

customer_reviews.title: Works great on PC, used it for Clone Hero, Guitar Hero
customer_reviews.text: Works right out of the bag(came in a bag lol), just wanted something to connect an old xbox 360 guitar hero guitar. Works great with Guitar Hero Clone, didnt have to do anything else and it was recognized right away. My guitar itself is a bit old and buttons were not registering, fix for that was the handle to the guitar body had its gold contacts worn out and I just had to move the contacts themselves. Other than that, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Literal Plug & Play
customer_reviews.text: I don't even have an optical drive for my PC, but luckily for Windows 10 users, all you have to do is plug it in, then follow the easy pairing instructions and you're good to go! I got this mainly for Forza Horizon 3 (Not as enjoyable on a keyboard). This is perfect, as I don't have to buy an Xbox One. Plus, I get a little extra life out of my Xbox 360 controllers ;)
customer_reviews.author: macman

customer_reviews.title: great product, easy to set up, lasts forever.
customer_reviews.text: I got this product back in 2014 and it still works perfectly and is super easy to set up, simply plug into your computer, let it install its drivers, then connect your controller and your all good to go. This little device is super rugged and has been used and abused over the years and hasn't had a single issue and I would highly recommend it. the only downside is that its a little expensive, though compared to its competitors it's not unreasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Brenden Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a cheap knock-off - this is the one you want
customer_reviews.text: I learned the hard way - bought two different off brand control dongles for the XBOX 360 controllers. Dang. I'm stupid. Neither of the cheaper ones worked with the Steam Link or the nVidia Shield Pro 2015. This controller was plug and play on both of the aforementioned devices however.
customer_reviews.author: Greenleaf Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Then I simply followed that easy instructions to pair with my Xbox 360 controller
customer_reviews.text: This is the official product from Microsoft, I simply plug it in to my new gaming laptop and it recognized everything with windows 10. Then I simply followed that easy instructions to pair with my Xbox 360 controller. I'm using this to play the Witcher 1 with a controller versus the keyboard the best free program I found was "joy to key" you can map the controller buttons how you want. I tried pinnacle games and others that have pre-mapped controller schemes , but think joy to key works the best and it's free
customer_reviews.author: SM113

customer_reviews.title: MAC OSX USERS READ THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: To make this (or any other 360 receiver) work on OSX... Google "tattieboggle" and download the driver If youre using Yosemite download version .11 of the tattieboggle driver not version .12. If youre using el capitan google "tattieboggle beta github" and download version .15 (beta 5). The driver works flawlessly but not all programs wil necessarily work with that type of input. I use openemu to play classic video games and its perfect. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Hook it up, sync it, play
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup and one time setup. I tried hooking up my playstation controller to my computer because it was free. My biggest complaint about that was that it never really paired with my computer. Randomly it would turn on the playstation on the other end of the house, support wasn't good, etc. Had I known that hooking up my Xbox controller with full support (even rumble) was such a small monetary jump away I would have done it much sooner. It stays synced to my computer, it's customizable, all pc/console released games have amazing integration, it was so simple to setup and I no longer have to think about it. So great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just plug and play.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, right when I heard that you can connect your Xbox remote to your PC, I always though it was going to be a big problem and you were going to need drivers and stuff. On this particular dongle you just plug, and play. and the games on steam automatically recognize it, so all you have to do is start up the game and you can began you using your remote. When you are in a game you can just touch the remote, and it will configure it right away, and if you want to use your keyboard and mouse you can simply just touch you mouse and it will automatically back to keyboard and mouse configurations.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This works GREAT to use XBOX controllers on the PC
customer_reviews.text: This works GREAT to use XBOX controllers on the PC. I use it for the XBOX Steering wheel and it works just like it does on the Xbox. It will allow up to 5 controllers at once; I'm using the wheel and one additional controller to give me more "buttons" for my games. I'm running Windows 10 and it was plug and play... with the included driver software. Once installed you just plug this into a USB port and press the connect button on the controller(s)... just like Xbox!
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: Not a knockoff... ACTUAL MICROSOFT WIRELESS GAMING RECEIVER
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews here state that you will receive a chinese knockoff gaming receiver instead of the official one produced by Microsoft. I was expecting the chinese knockoff version, but to my surprise, it was a genuine microsoft receiver. So it seems, it is hit or miss. Some of you may receive the chinese knockoff (which is pretty much the same thing, just a more difficult install) and some of you may receive the genuine microsoft one. I guess I was a lucky one, my package contained: 1) Microsoft Wireless Gaming Receiver 2) Microsoft xbox 360 accessory install cd 3) Microsoft instruction manual for gaming receiver 4) Microsoft quick install guide for gaming receiver
customer_reviews.author: MikeN

customer_reviews.title: Not the product that is advertised - beware
customer_reviews.text: Obviously not a "new" product as advertised - it came in a sketchy padded envelope without any Microsoft branding whatsoever. I tried connecting to two different PCs with two different controllers and neither the right stick nor the d-pad would function - both work fine with my console.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lisenbe

customer_reviews.title: Change pc gaming by using an xbox wireless controller with this adapter. 😊👍👊
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure how well this would work with a pc. However since Microsoft is with pc it works great. I love flight simulator games and instead of buying a $150+ controller I used my first generation wireless Xbox controller. It works great. Using the wireless controller adapter with a pc has changed my pc gaming.
customer_reviews.author: ppdjs725

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Works how it's supposed to. Occasionally seems to disconnect itself, although that may be due to the port it's plugged into, not the device, so I'm not taking away stars, just making it known in case anybody else has similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Direct Replacement for Microsoft Xbox 360 OEM Receiver
customer_reviews.text: It is a genuine Microsoft receiver. it appears to have at one time been paired with a wireless controller in a blister pack, but separated by a third party seller and sold by itself for console use only. My old receiver mysteriously stopped working with no signs of wear but well beyond the manufacturers warranty. I did not want to take a chance with a diminished functionality knock off, which appears to be what the other wireless receiver that is selling on amazon is. I assume this one will mysteriously quit working after two years, but by that time i will own a different generation of controller.
customer_reviews.author: Vitreous humor

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: The directions could be a little better but once setup it works great and is built well. I've had this thing for about 10 years and it still works like a charm. Definitely got my money's worth out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Blackthanos

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Gamers
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today and it took a while to figure out how to get the controller to connect to the receiver, but it works great so far! So much easier to play steam games that require a controller! Currently unsure how to turn off the receiver instead of just taking it out of the USB, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for PC Gamers
customer_reviews.text: Great device. Easily setup by plugging into USB slot and downloading appropriate drivers (easily located with Google search). From there, it functions as an Xbox 360 would; you can just sync wireless controllers to it as you would a system. I have been using mine for a long time now, and have hooked up somewhere between 4-6 controllers to it, with zero problems. Product works like a charm, and has been a godsend for allowing me to hook up my pile of Xbox controllers to my PC. A must-have for PC gamers who like to use Xbox 360 controllers for some of their games.
customer_reviews.author: Forschberr

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: This works quite well for my use case of connecting my Xbox 360 controllers to my Steam Link. The controllers work perfectly, with no perceptible input lag. The range is actually improved over my actual Xbox 360. Overall I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Random Human

customer_reviews.title: The build quality of the adapter is very nice and seems authentic
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of the adapter is very nice and seems authentic, however the packaging seems a bit fake. When I plugged it into Windows 10 machine, the driver downloaded automatically, and the item was recognized as "Microsoft Wireless 360 Adapter" immediately. I am using a white wireless Xbox 360 controller and have had no connection issues powering on/off or during gameplay. If it is a fake, you cannot tell. I am very satisfied with this item and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JR_TheFISH

customer_reviews.title: Breaths new life to the old xbox 360 controllers.
customer_reviews.text: Breaths new life to the old xbox 360 controllers. I've entered the world of the "PC master race" (I'm just kidding, I actually hate that phrase) It was a good controller on the xbox360 and this unit makes it work wirelessly and easily on the PC. this particular unit is made by microsoft. I know there are a lot of third party manufactures that make this same unit but i just feel more comfortable going with microsoft since they make the OS, the drivers, and the peripheral.
customer_reviews.author: Alkad Mzu

customer_reviews.title: Works great! After some help...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! But its not the 'official' Microsoft product. It comes with a small CD to install drivers but I didn't use that since I have a Surface Pro and have no CD reader. Fortunately, the drivers were installed through the USB cord when first plugged in. It WAS difficult to figure out how to get the computer to recognize the controller. I followed all the steps on this awesome youtube video  After that, remember to click the flashing button on the bottom start menu and you're golden. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Oz Kindle

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I can connect all my XBox 360 wireless controllers to my PC without much hassle. You have to fiddle around with some drivers first, but once you do it's easy to get it up and running.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ogleari

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good things about this
customer_reviews.text: First of all, these are impossible to find on their own at electronics and department stores. If you already have a number of wireless 360 controllers and want to be able to use them on your windows PC, this is a must buy. It works extremely well. Syncing is almost instantaneous and requires a simple button press on the receiver, and one on the controller. Switching it back to your 360 when the time comes is easy as well. Drivers installed quickly and I've used it to play games on many, many different games, all working perfectly. Never noticed any lag issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Add's awireless xbox360 controller to nearly any system. Tested on Hackintosh, Windows, Linux, FireTV, Android, Raspberry Pi2
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with a triple boot Hackintosh/Windows/Linux system and it works perfectly in all 3 OS's. It will also work fine on your Amazon FireTV, along with other Android devices. Great way to get a wireless controller working under about any system. This also works with the Raspberry Pi 2, using the xbox360 controller driver. I've successfully tested this item on the following systems: OS X Yosemite 10.10.2 (Hackintosh flavor) Windows 7 Linux (Mint 17, Cinnamon) Amazon FireTV Raspberry Pi 2 (using RetroPie) Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Chief Points

customer_reviews.title: Easily worth the $20 I paid for it
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly, I received a MS brand legitimate wireless receiver as opposed to a knock-off. This also came with a driver CD. The most up-to-date drivers can be downloaded from MS's website for free. With those installed this receiver worked instantly. The software runs in the background of your PC as long as its on, uses almost nothing of your CPU/RAM/HDD and literally detects a controller within a few seconds. Easily worth the $20 I paid for it. Now I can game using my PC in the living room like a true couch potato/stealthy console-killer!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bosboom

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Accessory
customer_reviews.text: I must say if you already have a xbox360 controller laying around (wireless) and want to use it for your computer gaming as well. This does the job perfectly. I am running windows 8.1 on a lenovo ideapad y410p. Plugged it up, automatically found and installed drivers. Turned on my controller, sync'd, and BAM ready to game. Works as should, and legit Microsoft OEM receiver. Happy with purchase, don't hesitate if this is the way you want to go. Note you DO NOT NEED windows specific controller, any wireless controller should sync up. I tried a generic brand controller i had laying around and it sync'd up fine. (PS3). Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Trangarion

customer_reviews.title: Pricy, but does its job.
customer_reviews.text: With the resurgence of Guitar Hero with Clone Hero, this product has spiked in price, which is dirty of Microsoft to do. Regardless, I had no problem connecting my guitar. Excellent little doohickey, but just way too costly for its worth.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Best way to play games on the PC
customer_reviews.text: I have long been a PC gamer but i don't enjoy playing first person shooters on the computer as they seem to be touchy and a mouse and button combinations just doesn't seem to be as smooth as the joysticks on my favorite controller of all time: the xbox 360 controller. It works without installing any drivers or software right out of the box and is intuitive to connect controllers to. I wish you could control windows with the controller but maybe i just need to find a third party software for that. For games it works flawlessly. I've noticed a little lag but i think it is my computer causing it not the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Who is the seller?
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews on here complain of knock offs. Pay close attention to who the seller is. I bought mine from EA electronics, and it is an official Microsoft adapter. I have only had it for a day, but I tested it on a bunch of platform games on Steam. It works great. Do not notice any lag, or drop in connection. Do your homework on the initial set up, depending on which OS you have. I have Windows 8, and it was a breeze. Get a driver form microsoft, install, play. (There is no Windows 8 driver, but I can confirm that windows 7 driver works. Pick 32 or 64 depending on what you have.)
customer_reviews.author: DocStrange

customer_reviews.title: Works with Xbox 360 and Xbox One controllers
customer_reviews.text: Works great with both 360/One controllers. No lag from what I can tell. Also works with the Steam Link, so I can play my PC games in the living room with my Xbox remote controllers. Works with multiple controllers for co-op games as well (I only tried it with 2, but I'm sure it can do more)
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Brings me right back to college, but on the PC.  Super easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: I built a PC awhile back for gaming and was gifted an xbox controller by a friend. I missed the old days of Call of Duty on the xbox and the controller and this receiver brings me right back there. The installation was easy, just plug it in and run the CD. After the CD installed basically every game automatically recognizes the xbox controller so there hasn't been any further set up. This was differently one of my fears because I could remember the old days of PC gaming where each game has to have the controller set up and calibrated...this couldn't have been easier.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i need it.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i need it. I got this wireless gamin receiver to be able hook my xbox 360 controller to my PC and play all games i got on 60 inch screen from the convenience of my couch. The receiver come with drivers, so you don't need to dig to find the right one. Once you install the content from the provided CD you just turn on the controller and pair it in a matter of seconds. It work flawless without any lag and execute all the commands with excellent precision. Graphics from my SLI GTX 770 are outstanding. Both my PS4 and xbox 360 are for sell now.
customer_reviews.author: Todor Jelev

customer_reviews.title: Not Working
customer_reviews.text: I followed all instructions on installation and my xbox 360 controller will not sync up. Official Microsoft drivers installed didn't work, nor did third party drivers, I tried EVERY "solution" online but non seem to work, my knowledge of computers and technology is extremely extensive so I am concluding my model is either defective or the product itself does not work. The controller and receiver will both be in sync mode, yet the controller will just start to blink and not connect. Horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I had one of the white ones for so long I can't remember, but it's nice to have a black one to match everything lol. My wife and I game together, so it works well. Pairs the controller you want paired to it so we can both wireless at the same time. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: InhumanArt

customer_reviews.title: My CD was warped but it may have been due to poor packaging. My two computers have vertical drives and ...
customer_reviews.text: Be careful. You may get an imitation. Make sure you order one that says Microsoft on the adapter and not XBOX360 (imitation). My CD was warped but it may have been due to poor packaging. My two computers have vertical drives and the CD didn't run. Anyway, I was able to burn the CD in a computer with a horizontal drive and could use the copy to install the controllers in my computer. I have 8.1 and the wireless Xbox controllers worked well after the installation.
customer_reviews.author: harp72

customer_reviews.title: Overall A Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The only dislike I have about this product is that: I either failed to read the details and to understand that this product comes with software that one must download through a CD/DVD disc, or that the seller failed to make this fact known that this piece of equipment is not a plug and chug download drivers only. Other then that it works and does what it is suppose to. I am satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Carino

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing!! Looking at the productr pictures and description now (I guess it changed), I assume its not the actual legitimate Microsoft product, but you could have fooled me. I got the black model with the light and "microsoft" in white letters at the top, and everything worked perfectly from day 1. Plugging it into USB, Windows 7 pulled up and installed the drivers, and I was off the the races. Havent had one issue since. Im actually probably going to but a second one pretty soon. If you own a gaming PC and an HDTV, this+ an Xbox 360 controller really is a must-have.
customer_reviews.author: xWCOGx

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product for all my gaming needs. From one experienced gamer to another, this is a must have item for playing PC games that simply don't play as well without the game pad. PROS: - Quick setup - Long range - Connect up to four remotes - It will remember the remote when turning off the game pad. - Doesn't fail connection over time. - Durable and lengthy CONS: - I honestly have no cons about this item, simple as that. Good product, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alec B.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to play racers and platformers more easily on the PC. Also, it makes flying helicopters and jets possible in Battlefield 3. It's a simple solution for using your existing Xbox controllers on your PC. As another reviewer states, plug it into the USB ports that are directly on the motherboard, otherwise you won't get enough power. I plugged it into one of the front USB ports and did the proper installation but it wouldn't connect. I plugged it into a back USB port, did the installation again and it worked right away. Simply connect the Xbox controller to the receiver then start the game. If it's compatible with a gamepad, it will work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you are building a retro-pie system...
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these devices so that I could use my Xbox 360 controllers with my retro-pie game system that I had built. It was a good buy, and works great. I think it would even work extremely well for PC gaming. It is especially nice that it supports many controllers being attached to it at once.
customer_reviews.author: Deoji

customer_reviews.title: Necessary PC gaming equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is an essential device if you enjoy PC gaming but want to use a wireless controller. It's plug and play and picks up your controller signal from quite a ways away actually (I've tested out to 75 feet and across two stories). People have a tendency to leave this on top of their towers. I would advise against that. The only reason these typically stop working is do to heat exposure (or water damage) from what I've seen. Anyway, if you use a wireless controller, this is a must own, and the best one out there that I've come across.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Faden

customer_reviews.title: This is the Real "Official" OEM Microsoft Xbox 360 Receiver for Windows.
customer_reviews.text: Hey All, This is the real thing! It is "Official" as stated. I have the OEM official xbox windows controller with this receiver but it just stop working after my house move. From reading review about this receiver they have this issue that it just stop respond and no light on the LED status light. And this one doesn't need to update it with any driver as my orginal has the windows driver. So it pretty much Plug & Play. Oh.... I got my from Lighting Modz vendor. I hope they fixed this issue. I will update this review if it breaks again.
customer_reviews.author: Master Q

customer_reviews.title: works much better than the other chinese knockoffs
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if this is official Microsoft or a good rip-off (the markings, other than saying 'microsoft' are pretty darn similar to the ones on my 3rd party chinese knockoff.. But let me say, this one keeps it's connection at the longer ranges that these receivers are SUPPOSED to work at. My chinese knockoff randomly disconnects and is extremely intermittent at best, this one keeps the connections to my controllers without issues. So, either way, this is the one to get if you're looking for a proper working X360 wireless receiver for your PC.
customer_reviews.author: Lucidry

customer_reviews.title: Great, reliable receives
customer_reviews.text: It was simple to set up, and it works very reliably. The only time I have issues connecting is when my controller is out of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harper

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty bogus that Microsoft designed the controller to not connect ...
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty bogus that Microsoft designed the controller to not connect over USB, but charge over USB fine. So basically this is essential to use the 360 controller on a PC. 5 stars for how essential it is, and it works perfectly. However 0 starts to Xbox HW product managers for not allowing the engineers to release a decent USB driver. Typical Microsoft bureaucratic nonsense.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Wallis

customer_reviews.title: Xbox 360 wireless receiver for PC
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all. Great product, fast delivery, and functions perfectly. No complaints whatsoever. Needed a way to connect one of my Xbox 360 wireless controller to my PC for gaming on Steam. I did not want to purchase another controller (wired), so I bought this item. Installed without a hitch, and the one I received certainly looks like a real Microsoft product with the badging, holographic stickers, documentation and included drivers. I am running Windows 7 64 bit and the driver disc was not necessary. Works as advertised. No problem with any game so far.
customer_reviews.author: RISC_Taker

customer_reviews.title: The real deal, not a cheap knockoff
customer_reviews.text: I've wasted money buying 2 of these from another manufacturer that were cheap knockoffs. They died within a couple of weeks of using. But this one.......this one is official! I've had this for over a year now and it still works perfectly! Comes with software for easy installation, or you can just use a google search for microsoft xbox 360 controllers and you will be set. I'm glad I bought this, and if you're second guessing about it, dont! This is the real deal, not a cheap knockoff, so it's built to last
customer_reviews.author: Legend

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: Got to use an x360 guitar with clone hero. Works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BKAZ

customer_reviews.title: Confirmed works with Windows XP
customer_reviews.text: Just FYI the led indicator on the one I received does not work hence the 3 star rating other than that it works ok. a couple of notes: - This uses the same driver as the microsoft xbox 360 usb bluetooth dongle, but the device will not be recognized (nor will the driver auto install) upon first insertion. Just point it to the path of that driver and you should be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: K C

customer_reviews.title: Works, looks legit.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about this being a counterfeit product, but everything seems OK. That being said, with everything being made in China and Microsoft having apparently discontinued this product, you never know. It's probably a bit like buying a Gucci bag made by the same guy with the same materials in China but no longer having the "official" Gucci seal of approval. Make sure you don't lose the installation CD that comes with this - I can't seem to track down online drivers, so if you don't have the CD then you may not be able to install it again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J.T.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working inexplicably less than a year after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This device worked well for a while, but then inexplicably died. It doesn't even detect when plugged into a computer anymore, and gives absolutely no indication that it is being powered. I suppose something magically broke mine, so I will give this 3 stars for the little bit of operation that I got out of it, as it did a good job of pairing with my wireless xbox controllers and headset... it would be nice if it had some more indicators on the device or some competent way of troubleshooting, but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: JudgeX

customer_reviews.title: Still works!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a long time at this point and I gotta say it’s done me well. Says a lot about it. Still use it to this day.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Best solution to use old Xbox 360 Controllers laying around
customer_reviews.text: Best solution to use old Xbox 360 Controllers laying around. They won't work on your Xbox One not even by using this adapter. But I found that you can use them to play Xbox One games if you stream Xbox One games to a Windows 10 Machine. The limitation being your network. I advice using Ethernet over WiFi to get the best picture quality. This saved my 7 Xbox 360 Controllers I was gonna leave setting in the dust. (Yes! 7 controllers! Long Story)
customer_reviews.author: Bader AlKoot

customer_reviews.title: It works how it should, no surprises
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play two-player PC games on my TV. The installation on Windows 8.1 Pro 64-bit was literally as simple as plugging it it and synchronizing the controllers to it. I received what essentially was an open-box product, but it did not bother me as it works perfectly. The one con, and the reason I only gave it 4 stars, is that there doesn't seem to be a good way to turn off the controller without removing the battery pack. A minor inconvenience, it will also time out after a few minutes of inactivity. Overall I'm very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben L.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful adapter.
customer_reviews.text: To me it looked totally genuine. It was packaged in generic OEM packaging and came with CD and official instructions. For Windows 8 64 bit all I had to do it plug it in, and windows found drivers and installed them in seconds. After syncing controller by pushing button on adapter and controller once, they find each other every time as soon as I turn on controller. Wonderful product. Very happy. Oh and BTW I tested it with OEM XBOX 360 force feedback steering wheel and pedal set and it worked just like on XBOX with force feedback and all.
customer_reviews.author: OhioPhotoPro

customer_reviews.title: Works nice, automatically installs on Windows computers.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Any game that can use a controller on steam this is what I use in tandem with my old school 360 controller.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Works Amazingly
customer_reviews.text: I have an XBOX but have recently begun switching to play PC games instead, but I still prefer playing games with a game pad this allows to do that. The first time that you plug it in, press the button on it and press the seek new connection on the XBOX controller and they hook up instantly. It will connect automatically when you turn on the controller until you connect it back to an XBOX at which point you will have to reconnect the two. PROS: Works quickly and easily Easy to hide behind computer $30 cheaper than the official Microsoft one CONS: If you don't trust off-brand than don't go with this one, because it isn't made by Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: evan mckee

customer_reviews.title: Showed up in a plain brown box with manual and ...
customer_reviews.text: Showed up in a plain brown box with manual and CD. I plugged it into my Ubuntu box and the hardware ID was correct when I ran lsusb (045e:0719 Microsoft Corp. Xbox 360 Wireless Adapter), so it appears to be legit. It worked perfectly on my computer without having to do anything else. I did have xpad from ppa:mdeslaur/steamos already installed and working with my wired controller beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Aquino

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawlessly with Windows 8.1 on mid-2014 Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I considered the cheaper ($12) alternatives being offered at the time, but went with this because it had 1,000 more reviews and an extra star for the average rating. Can't speak to whether the other ones would have worked, but this thing worked like a charm. I plugged it into my mid-2014 Macbook Pro running Windows 8.1, pressed the button on both it and the little pairing button on my 360 controller, and within about three seconds my computer had detected the controller, auto-downloaded the necessary driver for me, and configured it. Skyrim automatically detected the 360 controller when I opened it and switched over to the corresponding mode. Great experience, would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: great purchase to connect xbox 360 controller to amazon fire tv
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. bought it to connect xbox 360 contoller to amazon fire tv. just plugged into usb port, hit the sync buttons on the receiver and controller and instantly works. makes games a lot easier than the fire remote. well worth it and didn't have to buy another controller!
customer_reviews.author: Squashman

customer_reviews.title: Works out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Works well and consistently for what it says. Good value compared to what I looked at. I use this for hardcore gaming and never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Goddess_A

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to play with my Xbox controller on my pc. This worked out perfectly. Really easy set up, and small enough to not take up much desk space.
customer_reviews.author: Joey S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke After First Week
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first week.. after that ONE week it is no longer recognized by any of my computers. Inspecting the device there is a code 43 error (device unrecognized) and there is no online support for this issue. Definitely would not expect this out of a product of this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Surface compatible!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading the reviews knowing it was a fake but honestly I can't tell!!! I plugged it in and boom! Works perfectly Windows RT detected it with no problem!!!! installs with the correct drivers too! I've also tried this on my Windows 8 computer works with no problem! I would absolutely recommend this for anyone who plays hardcore games like street fighter, sports games etc.. I use this with my SNES emulator on my Surface and some racing games and couldn't be happier plus I can use two controllers on one receiver (haven't tried to connect more yet.)
customer_reviews.author: AMS

customer_reviews.title: Real Microsoft product works great
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected! Basically plugged it into my PC, connected it to my Xbox 360 remote according to the instructions, and games automatically knew what to do with it. I can play from across the room, no connectivity issues. I'd love if there was a better on-screen UI to configure settings, but it's not a deal-breaker because it works fine as-is.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: This is really awesome. There are certain PC games which I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really awesome. There are certain PC games which I have to use a controller for mainly driving games and fighters so this is excellent to connect my Xbox 360 controller too. I had to give it thee stars because it's a pretty cheaply made product. There is a fuse that is pretty loose and they tend to break easily. Mine did break and after some surgery (soldering) it's better then it was before. Honestly though I should not have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these. They appear to both be 1st party units. They look similar to the ones pictured but they do say Microsoft all over - including the tag on the cord, on both sides of the unit and on all documentation, and all the help info points to XBox/Microsoft sites. I know Microsoft made these receivers in white and black, I can only assume these are older 1st party units from before they were discontinued. Both of them came with a CD but we did not need to install it - plug & play worked on all 3 of our Win 7 PCs. So glad I took the chance on these rather than paying $80 for two controllers!
customer_reviews.author: J9592

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This worked exactly as intended. A little rough getting it to work initially, as I had previously had Motioninjoy installed on my PC to get it to work with Bluetooth and a PS3 controller, AND I am running Windows 7 64-bit. However, after a few uninstalls, reboots, and some quick Googling, I was able to get the drivers to properly recognize the receiver and get a controller to associate. Aside from the install process being a little more complicated than it probably should have been (partly my fault), I have no complaints about this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: THE way to use a 360 controller on the PC
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a wired controller that I would use on my PC but it fried out randomly after a couple years. It was probably because I left it plugged in all the time to my PC so it was always on. That is why I picked up this receiver instead so I do not have to worry about that happening again. It is a little bit of a hassle using 1 wireless controller for both a 360 and PC because I keep on having to resync the controller depending on what device I am using but it beat the unsightly wires and constant on state of the wired controller.
customer_reviews.author: CountChoculitis

customer_reviews.title: Xbox 360 Controller on PC.... Works Perfect.....
customer_reviews.text: Well I have used this receiver to connect my xbox controller for a few years now. And it works. There is not much I can say. On Windows 10 it installs drivers right away and works instantly. Just pair it with controller and you are good to go. It lasted for years for my and still works great. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Warning: This is not the official product!
customer_reviews.text: This is not an official Microsoft product, and does not work out of the box. That said, with some work and a few internet tutorials you can coax it into working...sometimes. The device is not recognized by Windows, so you have to manually select the drivers for it EVERY TIME YOU PLUG IT IN. Also, if you haven't used it in awhile, you'll have issues syncing, requiring you to, again, reinstall the drivers. Really, if this was as expensive as the real deal, I'd be sending it back, but at a savings of $40+, it's worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Real Microsoft product. Good quality and BLACK!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone reading all of the endless reviews I did, this is the actual Microsoft branded receiver for wireless controllers to interface with your PC. It is black and comes with the manual and driver disc (won't need it if you have Windows 7). It immediately worked on my computer and I have had a blast playing GTA and Saints Row games with it on the PC!
customer_reviews.author: DM1986

customer_reviews.title: The controller worked great the stream would lag sometimes so I found it ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to stream games to my computer from my Xbox one and use an old 360 controller instead of buying a new xbox one controller. The controller worked great the stream would lag sometimes so I found it better to play turn based games like X-Com 2.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: It just works and has a range of about 30 feet
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased the first one I bought years ago on the day it came out and it still works fine but I wanted to buy a second one because now I have a steam Link in my bedroom and this one work exactly the same as the original however unlike the original this one Blends in better because it's black instead of white
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not Straight Forward on Installing
customer_reviews.text: Like many users, I had a little trouble getting this installed. Windows was up for the challenge, and with the help of other posters, it installed just fine. I marked the controller so it isn't confused with one of the controllers designated for the xBox. Flawless operation. Every game I have tried it works perfectly. Pros: The operation and connectivity has been beautiful. Fast hook up. Game compatibility Cons: Getting it set up is not straight forward, but far from difficult. Phatso
customer_reviews.author: Phatso420

customer_reviews.title: xbox 360 RF
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing and easy to use! I always get tired of the long process to jimmy reg other things but this is literally a plug and play! Overall love this if your wondering how to get your xbox 360 controllers that are wireless to work with your pc look no further! When you plug it in, it will automatically download the drive and when you load games it will have controller map show up and you will be able to use it in game and works great love it some of the games have weird layouts but its not hard to get used to it because i love my controller for alot of games
customer_reviews.author: Pachuca Effect

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great for anyone using Xbox 360 controllers with a PC
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great for anyone using Xbox 360 controllers with a PC. I have an old computer that I am using as a streaming client for Steam In-House Streaming. I can play my favorite games on the big TV in the living room while my gaming rig upstairs handles all of the processing. It comes down to a thin client (running SteamOS beta) that is using two of these receivers. Works flawlessly with Windows and SteamOS. Linux support is community supported but is widely usable in most distributions.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This product is very easy to use. I am running Windows 7 64-bit on my Toshiba laptop and this product is a great from Microsoft. Pop in the disc, download the drivers, get your Xbox 360 controller and sync it up and you are good to go! I already had the Xbox 360 controller drivers for many operating systems downloaded on my hard drive so all I had to do was plug in the device and connect my controller. A definite recommended product for Games for Windows, PC gaming or emulators! No need to buy a 3rd party PC gaming pad!
customer_reviews.author: K-Dub

customer_reviews.title: It is genuine Microsoft product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in Microsoft packaging with Created by XBOX Microsoft authenticity seal. But...the reason I needed one is because my other genuine Microsoft gaming receiver stopped working so I am dubious it means much in terms of quality and reliability. ***UPDATE: I unplugged it from one computer and plugged into another. No light. Plugged it back in the 1st computer and no light. Doesn't show up in device manager. It is dead Jim. Updated the review score to match the poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. OCONNELL

product_meta.title: Microsoft Xbox 360 Wireless Receiver for Windows
product_meta.description: There are quandries big and small especially if you're confused about whether you want to use your XBox 360 or your PC for your gaming entertainment. You really enjoy your XBOX-360 wireless controls for your XBOX 360 console. Sometimes you prefer using your wireless Xbox-360 controls for playing PC games. Can this be done? This wireless receiver is a simple adapter that connects into a USB 2.0 port on your PC and lets you use use the Xbox 360 Wireless Controller, Xbox 360 Wireless Headset, and Xbox 360 Wireless Racing Wheel on your computer. A 6 foot cable lets you conveniently hook it up to a rear or front USB port. Use the 9Z200001 Xbox 360 Wireless Gaming Receiver for Windows and enjoy game playing every which way. It's a quck and easy solution! Plugs into a PC USB port and has a six foot cable Future drivers available for Windows Vista and Force Feedback for the Wireless Racing Wheel
feature_bullets: Works with current and future Xbox 360 wireless accessories.
Receiving range up to 30 feet with 4 different devices.
Powered by USB 2.0 port on PC, cable length approx. 6 ft. (180 cm).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,220 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
